meanings.definition: To confuse or complicate (a situation or task)
meanings.sent1: She was bollixing the puzzle pieces, mixing them all up.
meanings.sent2: Stop bollixing the instructions, just follow them step by step.
meanings.sent3: By bollixing the meeting schedule, we ended up in the wrong room.
meanings.sent4: His attempt to bollix the enemy's plans only made them stronger.
meanings.sent5: The magician's trick was like bollixing a magic show with no magic tricks.

meanings.definition: To make a mess of something
meanings.sent1: He kept bollixing the kitchen by spilling ingredients everywhere.
meanings.sent2: The kids always bollix the living room with their toys scattered around.
meanings.sent3: She managed to bollix the art project by using the wrong colors.
meanings.sent4: The storm came through and bollixed the neatly arranged garden.
meanings.sent5: The chef accidentally bollixed the recipe by adding too much salt.

meanings.definition: To bungle or botch something up
meanings.sent1: I tend to bollix things up when I rush through them.
meanings.sent2: The new employee bollixed up the presentation by forgetting key points.
meanings.sent3: His attempt to fix the leak only bollixed the plumbing situation further.
meanings.sent4: She managed to bollix up the surprise party by revealing the secret too soon.
meanings.sent5: The comedian's joke fell flat, completely bollixing up the performance.
